Description: Two fragments of broad, red woollen ribbon, with a brocaded design; Design comprising a repeated lattice motif enclosing small roundels, with pointed leaves on stalks at the junctions and zig-zag borders; Warp: S spun Z ply wool, c.15tpc; Weft: S spun paired wool, c.12 pairs per cm), weft brocading in S spun, paired undyed linen, a pattern thread in each shed, mainly floating over 2 warp ends; Edges: two selvedges each with one group of warp thread with extra weft circuits of main weft around this; Sewing: remains in running stitch along one edge in S spun Z ply cream thread
Curator's comments: Unreg 44; Similar to EA72426; Discovered 1988? in the Keeper's office, previous location cupbaord O; Originally applied to the edges of a garment by sewing and woven for this purpose; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (22.3.1991)
